Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit where it pleases - "waiting my turn" -, while the Dutch continue with "you first", despite having ever less travel paths left to choose from.

I think that this clash bears some resemblance with how privileged first-world countries need to face up to how they

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to this hybrid between historical drama and thriller.

After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) making her life better. In both cases she risks everything to escape into a Utopia like one ruled by robots.
The only difference was that in America 3000, her boyfriend comes along as his role is diminished.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen creature from thousands and thousands of years ago. Unfortunately for them, this creature wants to claim his kidnaps as food!
This movie wasn’t very good, there is just one bad night vision scene that made it worth watching the film though

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa falls off a building trying to prove his super-sized ego. Meanwhile, Tom picks up stray kittens from around town so he can cash in on government food subsidies for cut developmentally disabled children.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes man ! My meter was off to 9/10 because of Cooper and McGregor.
Considered one of Fleabag ‘s weirdest episodes, Happy Christmas flips “Yule” into a parody of retail that goes with previous found-footage references in the show’s history.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics and themes from Ninja and Eighties films such as Big Trouble In Little China And Indiana Jones with obvious nods at Schwarzenegger's Conan and Stallone's Rambo ; Directed by his
